text:
The rise of cloud computing
has companies globally,

across all industries,
racing to build world-class

cloud teams to support their
digital transformation
efforts.

This has caused a sharp rise
in the demand for cloud leaders

and engineers with the skills
and experience needed to support
these transformations.

The success of an organization’s
cloud transformation

correlates directly with the
skill and motivation of the people
within it.

Organizations that wish to drive
meaningful change must find

a way to bridge their skill
gaps.

The good news is, that you likely
already have the people you need
to be successful with the cloud.

That’s because it’s more efficient
to take people who are already

familiar with your company,
your process, your people,

your systems, and your culture,
and teach them cloud skills,

rather than bring in new people
with cloud skills and teach
them how your company works.

It is not only more cost-effective
to train existing employees

than it is to recruit cloud
engineers, but it also fosters

a sense of camaraderie,
teamwork, and morale—all

things that will be critical
to your success as you transform
with the cloud.

Before embarking on an upskilling
campaign to bridge the talent

gap within your organization,
it’s important to ensure you

have buy-in from your employees
ahead of time.

They should see your company’s
cloud adoption as the opportunity

that it truly is: an opportunity
to transform their careers,
rather than a threat to job security.

Employees also need to know
the reasons why they’re being

asked to learn something
new.

They need to have confidence
that it will be successful.

And they need to know what’s
in it for them.

Fortunately, these transformations
present a tremendous opportunity
to transform people’s careers.

Data center operators become
cloud administrators;

infrastructure admins become
cloud engineers.

This is an opportunity
to not only learn the skills

and gain the experience
that will make your employees

more valuable in the marketplace,
but to also make their job more
enjoyable and be a part of history.

It's important to communicate
these things to them.

Let them know how they will
be supported through this change.

Let them know they will be trained,
certified, and given opportunities

to have firsthand experience
with these new skills, skills

that every organization
in the world needs right now.

They need to know how much more
valuable they will become

to your organization
and in the marketplace,

and how much more satisfying
their jobs will become.

They need to know how this opportunity
can open the door to a whole
new career path for them.
So, get buy-in from your employees.

Get them trained in the cloud
and then give them opportunities
to use their new skills.

You will significantly
increase your odds of success.
